intro: Ibbetsonia genistoides, commonly known as the slender broom, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, with slender, branched stems. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
